title: Calories in Guacamole
meta_description: Discover calories in guacamole per 100g serving, including carbs, fat, protein, fiber, and tips for variations in this avocado-based dip.
assumptions: Homemade guacamole with avocados, lime juice, onion, tomato, cilantro, garlic, and salt; no added oils or creams.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredient freshness, portion size, and brand for store-bought; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of guacamole contains about 160 kcal, mostly from healthy avocado fats.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use more tomatoes and less avocado (lower fat version)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of guacamole?

faqs.a: Yes, about 15g fat per 100g, primarily healthy monounsaturated fats from avocados.

faqs.q: What are the carbs and fiber in guacamole?
faqs.a: Around 9g carbs and 7g fiber per 100g, making it low net carb.
Minimal, about 2g per 100g; it's not a significant protein source.

faqs.q: How does homemade guacamole compare to store-bought calories?
faqs.a: Homemade is often lower (160 kcal/100g) than store-bought, which may add 20-50 kcal from oils or preservatives.
